title: De Renoir a Picasso
creator_credit: Paul Haesaerts and Jean Van Raemdonck
brief_description: Part of the “Art et cinema” series, this film presents a study and comparison of the characteristics of Renoir the sensualist, Seurat, the intellectual, and Picasso, the instructive artist, the three main inspirational sources for modern French art. The soft, rounded forms of Renoir are related to the Greek ideal of physical beauty, Seurat’s severe simplification are shown to echo Byzantine style; and Picasso’s distortions are traced back to similar experiments in primitive art.
